member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExpandEffects
member.summary: This object encapsulates the Internet Explorer Transitions functionality that UltraWebGrid's expandable objects expose.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExpandEffects.#ctor
member.summary: Returns a reference to the ExpandEffects object for the Grid control.

remarks.p: The ExpandEffects object encapsulates the settings of the expansion effects that can be applied to expandable objects. You can use this object to specify an effect such as Fade In, Iris, Slide, Gradient Wipe or Pixelate. This object also contains properties for controlling the effects that will be applied during the transition, such as delay and duration, and that will be applied to the expandable objects during and after the transition, such as opacity and drop shadow.

The transition effects applied to the expandable objects rely on the transition features built into Internet Explorer version 5 or greater. These settings are ignored in down-level browsers or any version of Netscape. The visual effects are also operating system dependant, and may not be available on all systems.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExpandEffects.CopyFrom(Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExpandEffects)
member.summary: Applies the attributes of an existing ExpandEffects object to the current ExpandEffects object, using the property categories specified.

remarks.p: Invoke this method to copy some or all of an existing object's property settings to another object of the same type.

By default, all the properties of the object are copied. You can also specify that only certain categories of properties should be copied form the one object to the other. Multiple categories can be copied by combining them using logical Or.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExpandEffects.Reset
member.summary: Resets all properties of the class to their default values.

remarks.p: Invoke this method to reset all properties of the Band class to their default values.
The "ShouldSerialize" properties of the ExpandEffects object will return False until set again.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExpandEffects.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of the ExpandEffects object.

remarks.p: Some objects do not have values that can be converted to a string. In these cases, an empty string is returned. The ExpandEffects object will return an empty string.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExpandEffects.Duration
member.summary: Specifies the amount of time elapsed in milliseconds between the beginning and the end of a transition effect.

remarks.p: This is the amount of time it takes the expand effect to occur. If is set to ExpandEffectsType.Notset, this setting has no effect.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExpandEffects.Opacity
member.summary: Specifies the amount of transparency applied to the expandable object after the expand effect is complete.

remarks.p: This property specifies the opacity of the expandable object as a percentage. A setting of 100 is completely opaque, a setting of 0 is completely transparent (invisible). A setting in between these values will produce a partially visisble expandable object through which the contents of the page may be seen.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExpandEffects.ShadowColor
member.summary: Specifies the color of the drop shadow that will appear under the expandable object.

remarks.p: Drop shadows provide an illusion of depth to expandable objects as they appear over the web page. You can specify the width of the drop shadow using the property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExpandEffects.ShadowWidth
member.summary: Specifies the width of the drop shadow that will appear under the expandable object.

remarks.p: Drop shadows provide an illusion of depth to expandable objects as they appear over the web page. Set this property to 0 to eliminate the drop shadow. You can specify the color of the drop shadow using the property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExpandEffects.Delay
member.summary: Specifies the amount of time elapsed before an expandable object will open up in response to a mouse click or a mouseover.

remarks.p: The default delay is 200 milliseconds. This property specifies the time that will elapse before the expand effect begins.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ExpandEffects.ViewState
member.summary: Gets a dictionary of state information (StateBag) that allows you to save and restore the view state of a server control across multiple requests for the same page.

remarks.p: A server control's view state is the accumulation of all its property values. In order to preserve these values across HTTP requests, ASP.NET server controls use this property, which is an instance of the StateBag class, to store the property values. The values are then passed as a variable to an HTML hidden input element when subsequent requests are processed. For more information about saving server control view state, see Maintaining State in a Control.

summary.para: A custom Type Editor for the tree. This Editor invokes a FileDialog for retrieving url paths
This is an override from UITypeEditor. The property grid will call this when it wants to display the editor for the given value.
This is an override from UITypeEditor. The editor style indicates what type of editor we are providing: we can either display a dialog or a drop-down box. Our editor always shows a drop-down box.
This is an override from UITypeEditor and indicates if we support painting a small representation of our value in the property grid.

member.summary: Returns or sets a value that specifies the horizontal alignment of the text associated with a object.

The Center setting horizontally centers text in the object.

The Justify setting horizontally aligns text so that text is aligned at both the left and the right of the object.

The property is used to align text horizontally.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.GroupByBox.Prompt
member.summary: Returns or sets a string of text that indicates to the user how to perform GroupBy operations.

remarks.p: The default value of this property is "Drag a column header here to group by that column."
The prompt will not be shown unless the property is set to OutlookGroupBy.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.GroupByBox.Location
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that specifies where the band labels are rendered to the client.

remarks.p: The Top (default) setting renders the GroupByBox band labels above the grid on the client.
The Bottom setting renders the GroupByBox band labels below the grid on the client.
The band labels will not be shown unless the property is set to OutlookGroupBy.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.GroupByBox.BandLabelStyle
member.summary: Returns a reference to or sets a object that determines how the band labels are rendered on the client.

remarks.p: Individual style attributes can be applied by setting the GridItemStyle object's corresponding properties. For example, a style's background color can be changed by setting its BackColor property.
A comprehensive pre-defined style can be applied by setting the GridItemStyle object's CssClass property to the name of the style.
The band labels will not be shown unless the property is set to OutlookGroupBy and the property is set to a value other than None.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.GroupByBox.HasBandLabelStyle
member.summary: Returns a Boolean value that determines whether the property is currently set to a object.

remarks.p: This property returns True if the BandLabelStyle property is currently set; otherwise, it returns False.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.GroupByBox.ShowBandLabels
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that specifies the style of the type of band levels shown in the GroupByBox.

remarks.p: This property is used to specify the way in which band labels are rendered on the client when the GroupByBox is enabled.
The All setting will display all band labels.
The None setting will not display any band labels.
The AllWithGroupByColumnsOnly setting will only display band lables for bands for which there is a GroupBy column.
The IntermediateBandsOnly setting will display labels for bands that are between the first band with a GroupBy column and the last band with a GroupBy column, including those bands.
The Default (default) setting will use the None setting with single-band views and the IntermediateBandsOnly setting for multi-band views.
Regardess of the value of this property, band labels will not be displayed unless the property is set to OutlookGroupBy.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.GroupByBox.Hidden
member.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean value that determines whether the box is hidden.

remarks.p: This property returns True if the GroupByBox box is currently hidden; otherwise, it returns False.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.GroupByRow
member.summary: The GroupByRow object is a row that represents a grouped column. All rows in the data source that have common/equal values in the column that is grouped will be children of the GroupByRow object. The GroupByRow object contains a reference to the grouped column as well as a reference to the particular value that the child rows have in common.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow
member.summary: The UltraGridRow displays a row of data in the grid. A row typically represents the data from a single record in the attached datasource.

remarks.p: The UltraGridRow object represents a single row of data, and corresponds to a single record in the underlying recordset. Rows occupy a position in the data hierarchy of the UltraGrid between Cells and Bands. The UltraGridRow object is always the child of an UltraGridBand object, and its children are UltraGridCell objects.
Much of the data-binding functionality of the grid involves working with the UltraGridRow object. Whenever an UltraGridRow object is loaded by the grid, the event is fired.

UltraGridRow objects can influence the formatting of the cells they contain through the setting of the UltraGridRow's property. Rows can also be formatted independently of the cells they contain. Frequently, cells are drawn from the top of the row to the bottom and are aligned edge to edge so that they occupy the entire area of the row; the row itself is not visible because cells are always "above" the row in the grid's z-order. However it is possible to specify spacing between and around cells that lets the underlying UltraGridRow object show through. Only then will formatting applied directly to the UltraGridRow object be visible to the user.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.IsChild(Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow)
member.summary: Specifies whether the passed-in row is the direct child of the current row.

remarks.p: You can invoke this method to determine whether ther is a single-level parent/child relationship between two rows. You supply a reference to the UltraGridRow object you want to test in relation to the object on which you invoke the method.

Note that this method tests for a direct parent/child relationship, and will not test for rows more than one level below the current row. In other words, this method will test for childhood, but not grandchildhood. To find out whether this row is descended of another row that is more than one level below it, use the method.

member.param: The UltraGridRow object being examined to determine parenthood of the row.
member.returns: True if the supplied row is the immediate child of the current row, False if the row is not the immediate child.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.IsDescendant(Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow)
member.summary: Specifies whether the passed-in row is a descendant of the current row.

remarks.p: You can invoke this method to determine whether there is any parent/child relationship between two rows. You supply a reference to the UltraGridRow object you want to test in relation to the object on which you invoke the method.

Note that this method tests for a parent/child relationship across all levels of the data hierarchy, and will determine if a row is descended directly from another row or from any descnedant of that row. To find out whether this row is decended directly from another row, use the method.

member.param: The UltraGridRow object being examined to determine ancestorhood of the current row.
member.returns: True if the supplied row is an ancestor of the current row at any level, False if the row is not an ancestor.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.NextSiblingParent
member.summary: Returns the next row available. If the next sibling is not available it moves to the next higher level and attempts to return the next non-null sibling row until it traverses to the top of the hierarchy and there are no further sibling rows available.

member.summary: Returns string representation of the value of the specified cell.

member.returns: A string value that represents the text displayed in the cell, or a text representation of the cell's value, if possible.

member.returns: The unformatted value of a cell as retrieved from the datasource.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.Activate
member.summary: Sets the current row as the active row.

remarks.p: Only one row in the grid at a time may be the active row. The active row is the one that receives the input focus. If a row is being edited, that row is automatically the active row. However, a row may also be active without being in edit mode.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.ExpandAncestors
member.summary: Expands all ancestor rows of the current row.

remarks.p: Use this method to insure that all ancestor rows of the current row will be expanded and visible to the end user.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.Delete
member.summary: Deletes the current row.

remarks.p: This method will delete a row from the grid. It will also delete the corresponding record from the recordsource, provided deletion is an allowed action and the control has been properly configured to implement record deletion.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.CompareTo(System.Object)
member.summary: Compares the row to the sorted data in the band and returns the row's position within the sort order.

remarks.p: This method takes into account the columns being used to sort the current band, and compares the corresponding values in the current row to those of other rows in the band.

member.returns: A long integer value representing the row's position within the sort order of the band/

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.IsSelectable
member.summary: Determines whether the row may be selected, based on the current selection settings of the grid and the band.

remarks.p: This property indicates whether the row can be selected by the end user. This method takes into account the selection strategies in effect in teh grid, but is not based on current selection status.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.IsAlternate
member.summary: Determines whether the row is an alternate (even-numbered) row.

remarks.p: The UltraWebGrid provides a number of formatting options designed to increase data readability, and one of these is the ability to apply distinct formatting to odd and even numbered rows. By formatting alternating rows with different colors and/or attributes, it is easier for the user to see what data constitutes a row and keep the data in the rows separated. This is especially true when the rows of a band are set up to use multiple levels, so that each row of data may appear, for example, three cells high on screen.
Use this method to determine whether the current row is an alternate row. Alternate rowscan have a different style from non-alternate rows by assigning style attibutes via the property.

member.returns: True if the row is alternate (even-numbered), False if the row is not alternate (odd-numbered).

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.IsActiveRow
member.summary: Determines whether the row is the active row.

remarks.p: Only one row in the grid at a time may be the active row. The active row is the one that receives the input focus. If a row is being edited, that row is automatically the active row. However, a row may also be active without being in edit mode.
Use this method to determine whether a row is currently the active row.

member.returns: True if the row is the active row, False otherwise.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.IsExpanded
member.summary: Determines whether the row is currently expanded.

remarks.p: If a row is expanded, any child row it has are visible in the grid.

member.returns: True if the row is expanded, False otherwise.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.Key
member.summary: Returns or sets a unique string identifier for this Row within the UltraGridRows collection.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.Activated
member.summary: Indicates whether this row has been activated.

remarks.p: A row that has been activated becomes the active row. There can only be one active row in the grid.

A row can become active by the user clicking on a cell in the row, by the user clicking on the row area itself, or by the user clicking on the row's row selector. The active row can also be set programmatically in an event procedure.
When a row becomes the active row, or the active row changes, the event occurs.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.Band
member.summary: Returns the UltraGridBand object of the band that contains the row.

remarks.p: The Band property of an object refers to a specific band in the grid as defined by an UltraGridBand object. You use the Band property to access the properties of a specified UltraGridBand object, or to return a reference to the UltraGridBand object that is associated with the current object.

UltraGridBand objects are the foundation of the hierarchical data structure used by UltraWebGrid. Bands are also used to apply consistent formatting and behavior to the rows that they comprise. An UltraGridBand object is used to display all the data rows from a single level of a data hierarchy. UltraGridBand objects contain multiple sets of child UltraGridRow objects that actually display the data of the recordset.

The rows of a band are generally displayed in groups of one more. How rows appear grouped depends on their relationship to the rows of the previous (parent) band and to any child rows which are in the following (child) band. For example, if a hierarchical recordset has tables that display Customer, Order and Order Detail data, each one of these record sets maps to its own band in the UltraWebGrid. The rows in the Customer band will appear separated by any Order data rows that exist for the customers. By the same token, rows in the Order band will be appear separated to make room for Order Detail rows.

Although the rows in a band may appear to be separated, they are treated contiguously. When selecting a column in a band, you will see that the cells of that column become selected in all rows for the band, regardless of any intervening rows. Also, it is possible to collapse the hierarchical display so that any children of the rows in the current band are hidden.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.Cells
member.summary: Returns a collection of the UltraGridCell objects that make up the row.

remarks.p: This property returns a reference to a collection of UltraGridCell objects that can be used to access the UltraGridCell objects that belong to a row. You can use this reference to access any of the returned collection's properties or methods, as well as the properties or methods of the objects within the collection.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.DataChanged
member.summary: Indicates whether the row's data has been edited or this is a new or deleted row and the changes did not yet committed to the database

remarks.p: This property returns value that is different from Unchanged when a row's data has changed or this is a new or deleted row, but has not yet been committed to the data source; otherwise, it returns Unchanged.

When the value of a cell is changed by user interaction this property is set to corresponding value and the and events are generated. Note that the cell's new value is not necessarily committed to the data source at this time, since various factors can affect when the actual update occurs. Once the data source is actually updated, this property is set back to Unchanged.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.Height
member.summary: The height of the row, in pixels.

remarks.p: The height returned by this property excludes any spacing that may appear between rows.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.HeightResolved
member.summary: The height of the row, in pixels. This property will always return the setting that is in control of the row.

remarks.p: Row height is controlled by the property. However, Height may be set to a "use default" value, meaning the setting of the property is inherited from the property of the UltraGridLayout object. RowHeightDefault may also be set to its "use default" value, which means the value used for rrow heihgt is the preset one built into the UltraWebGrid.

To simply find out the row height used in the current band, use the HeightResolved property. This property resolves any inheritance issues and returns a value that tells you the actual height in pixels of the row.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.RowSelectorStyle
member.summary: An object that contains the style properties for the row selector.

remarks.p: Use this property to provide a custom style for the row selector. Common style attributes that can be adjusted include: forecolor, backcolor, font, and alignment. You can use different styles to provide a consistent look throughout your application, enhance the appearance of certain areas of the grid, or to call attention to important data.

Row selectors appear to the left of row data in the grid. By clicking on a row selector, the user can activate and select a specific row. Use this property to determine how the row selector for the row will be formatted. The setting of this property may be inherited from the band level.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.Hidden
member.summary: Determines whether the object will be displayed.

remarks.p: The Hidden property determines whether an object is visible. Hiding an object may have have effects that go beyond simply removing it from view. For example, hiding a band also hides all the rows in that band. Also, changing the Hidden property of an object affects all instances of that object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.Selected
member.summary: Determines the selected state of the row.

remarks.p: If the row has been selected by the user, this property returns True. Otherwise, it returns False.

There are differnt ways for the user to select a row, the most common being to click on the row selector for that row. Once a row is selected it is added to the collection, so any row that returns True for this property will be a member of that collection.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.Sizing
member.summary: Determines whether the row height can be changed.
member.p: If row sizing is permitted, users can resize rows by clicking on the line that separates row selectors and dragging up or down.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.SizingResolved
member.summary: Determines whether the row height can be changed. This property will always return the setting that is in control of the row.

remarks.p: Row sizing is controlled by the property. However, if a band is a child of another band, AllowColSizing may be set to a "use default" value, meaning the setting of the property is inherited from the parent band. If the parent band is a child of another band, it may also be inheriting a value for this property, so its own AllowColSizing property would also be set to the "use deafult" setting. Even if the band is a top-level band, AllowColSizing may be set to its "use default" value, which means the value used is the preset one built into the UltraWebGrid.

To simply find out whether rows can be resized in the current band, use the SizingResolved property. This property resolves any inheritance issues and returns a value that tells you whether row sizing is allowed for the band.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.ParentRow
member.summary: Returns the row immediately above the current one in the data hierarchy, if any.

remarks.p: Rows in teh top-level band (Band 0) will not have a parent row. For any other bands, each row is descended from a row in the previous band. This is the row returned by this property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.Level
member.summary: Returns the number of the band containing the row within the grid's data hierarchy. This property is read-only.

remarks.p: You can use the Level property to determine the level of the data hierarchy (i.e. band) where the row appears.

member.p: You can use this property to access all the child UltraGridRow objects of the current row.

summary.p: Returns or sets a Boolean value that determines whether a Row object is displayed with an expand image next to it, regardless of whether or not it has children. This property is only effective in conjunction with the use of the LoadOnDemand property of the DisplayLayout object.

remarks.p: Set this property to true if LoadOnDemand is set to Manual and you want to indicate that the node can be expanded even though it doesn't have any child nodes.
When the user then clicks the expandsion indicator, the DemandLoad event will be fired on the server, providing the application with the opportunity to load the row with children.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow.ViewState
member.summary: Gets a dictionary of state information (StateBag) that allows you to save and restore the view state of a server control across multiple requests for the same page.

remarks.p: A server control's view state is the accumulation of all its property values. In order to preserve these values across HTTP requests, ASP.NET server controls use this property, which is an instance of the StateBag class, to store the property values. The values are then passed as a variable to an HTML hidden input element when subsequent requests are processed. For more information about saving server control view state, see Maintaining State in a Control.

A comprehensive pre-defined style can be applied by setting the GridItemStyle object's CssClass property to the name of the style.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.Pager.PageSize
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that specifies the number of records per data page that are displayed when paging is enabled.

remarks.p: The default value this property is 8.
The value of this property determines the default value of the property.
Paging can be enabled by setting the property to True.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.Pager.HasStyle
member.summary: Returns a Boolean value that determines whether the property is currently set to a object.

remarks.p: This property returns True if the Style property is currently set; otherwise, it returns False.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.Pager.CurrentPageIndex
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that specifies the current data page displayed by the grid.

remarks.p: When paging is enabled, this property specifies the page of data currently being displayed.
When paging is not enabled for the grid, this property always returns, and can only be set to, 1.
Paging can be enabled by setting the property to True.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.Pager.PageCount
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that specifies the total number of data pages that exist when paging is enabled. Setting of the value makes sense only if you use custom paging. In the regular mode the property is set automatically.

remarks.p: The default value this property the total number of records divided by the value of the property, rounded to the nearest integer.
When paging is not enabled for the grid, this property always returns 1.
Paging can be enabled by setting the property to True.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.Pager.AllowCustomPaging
member.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean value that determines whether custom paging is allowed.

remarks.p: True if the grid allows custom paging; otherwise, False (default).
Paging enables the grid to display data as multiple pages, rather than simply one page at a time.

When custom paging is enabled, it is the application's responsibility to provide a DataSource that has the exact set of rows to be displayed. The control will start at the beginning of the DataSource and load the number of rows specified by the property. In this scenario, the DataSource query has to be adjusted to return the correct set of rows, based upon the property or other criteria.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.Pager.AllowPaging
member.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean value that determines whether paging is allowed.

remarks.p: True if the grid allows paging; otherwise, False (default).
Paging enables the grid to display data as multiple pages, rather than simply one page at a time.
When paging is enabled, the number of the current data page is displayed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.Pager.StyleMode
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that specifies the type of user interface to render on the client.

remarks.p: The Numeric (default) setting renders the interface as a set of page numbers, beginning with 1 and ending with the value of the property.
When paging is not enabled for the grid, this property is ignored.
Paging can be enabled by setting the property to True.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.Pager.PagerAppearance
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that specifies where the class information is rendered to the client.

remarks.p: The Top setting renders the information above the grid on the client.
The Bottom (default) setting renders the information below the grid on the client.
The Both setting renders the information above and below the grid on the client.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.Pager.Alignment
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that specifies the horizontal alignment of the text displayed when paging is enabled.

remarks.p: The Left setting horizontally aligns the text at the left.
The Center setting horizontally aligns centers the text.
The Right (default) setting horizontally aligns the text at the right.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.Pager.PrevText
member.summary: Returns or sets a string of text that is displayed in the "Previous Page" link when the grid allows paging.

remarks.p: The default value of this property is "Prev".
The text that is displayed for the "Next Page" link is specified by the property.
The "Previous Page" link will not be shown unless the property is set to True and the property is set to PrevNext.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.Pager.NextText
member.summary: Returns or sets a string of text that is displayed in the "Next Page" link when the grid allows paging.

remarks.p: The default value of this property is "Next".
The text that is displayed for the "Previous Page" link is specified by the property.
The "Next Page" link will not be shown unless the property is set to True and the property is set to PrevNext.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.Pager.CustomLabels
member.summary: Returns or sets a list of strings that determine the text to be displayed in lieu of page indices when paging is enabled.

remarks.p: This property is ignored unless the property is set to True and the property is set to CustomLabels.
When this property is set, the corresponding text label is displayed instead of the page's index.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.RowsCollection
member.summary: The Rows Collection manages a set of UltraGridRow objects which are the child rows of an individual Row.

remarks.p: The UltraGridRow objects in a Rows Collection make up a data island. The top-level Rows of a grid are all part of a single data island.

If the grid is hierarchical, then one or more top-level UltraGridRow objects will have its own Rows Collection, which contains one or more Row objects. This creates a tree structure of parent rows and child rows that is used to display hierarchical data.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.RowsCollection.GetNextRowDepthFirst(Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraGridRow)
member.summary: This method returns the next UltraGridRow within the grid's overall hierarchical structure.
member.p: This method is useful for navigating the structure of the grid as it appears when all rows are expanded. You can find out wich row occurs immediately after a specific row (appearing immediately under it on the screen) by passing the row's UltraGridRow object to this method.

If the specified row has child rows, the first one is returned. Otherwise, if the row has a next sibling, that sibling is returned. Otherwise, the parent chain is searched to see if the row's parent has a next sibling.
member.param: An UltraGridRow object for which you want to obtain the next row in the grid.
member.returns: An UltraGridRow object that correpsonds to the row appearing immediately following the passed-in row in the overall data hierarchy.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.SortedColsCollection
member.summary: The collection of UltraGridColumn objects that are being used to sort the data in the band.

remarks.p: You can sort data in a Band on a column-by-column basis by choosing the columns you want to use as sort criteria and sorting them. As you choose a column to sort on, its UltraGridColumn object is added to the SortedCols collection. You can use this collection to determine which columns that are being used to sort the Band and to access the UltraGridColumn objects for those columns as needed.

member.summary: Clone the Strings object

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.Strings.AddNewPrompt
member.summary: Returns or sets a string of text that is displayed to the left of the button.

remarks.p: The default value of this property is "Add..."
If the AddNewBox button is hidden, the text specified by this property is not visible.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.Strings.GroupByBoxPrompt
member.summary: Returns or sets a string of text that indicates to the user how to perform GroupBy operations.

remarks.p: The default value of this property is "Drag a column header here to group by that column."
The prompt will not be shown unless the property is set to OutlookGroupBy.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.Strings.GroupByRowDescriptionMaskDefault
member.summary: A string that determines what text is shown in GroupBy rows. This is the default value that may be overridden by individual bands.
member.remarks: The GroupByRowDescriptionMaskDefault property can include special substitution strings that will be replaced with information from the grid. For example, you can use them to specify child row count of a GroupBy row. By default, the [caption], [value], and [count] substitution strings are set. The column header text gets placed into the [caption] field, the common cell value gets placed into the [value] field, and the number of rows sharing the common value is placed into the [count] field.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.Strings.NoDataMessage
member.summary: A string value that specifies the message that should be displayed when the grid contains no data.

remarks.p: The default message is "No Data To Display".

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.Strings.NullTextDefault
member.summary: Specifies how null values will be represented in the grid. This is the default value that may be overridden by individual band.

remarks.p: This property spcifies a string value that will be displayed in a grid cell whenever a null value is received for that cell from the back end. The default setting is to use an empty string (""). However, you can specify any string you want, such as the words "null" or "empty".

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.Strings.PagerNextText
member.summary: Returns or sets a string of text that is displayed in the "Next Page" link when the grid allows paging.

remarks.p: The default value of this property is "Next".
The text that is displayed for the "Previous Page" link is specified by the property.
The "Next Page" link will not be shown unless the property is set to True and the property is set to PrevNext.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.Strings.PagerPrevText
member.summary: Returns or sets a string of text that is displayed in the "Previous Page" link when the grid allows paging.

remarks.p: The default value of this property is "Prev".
The text that is displayed for the "Next Page" link is specified by the property.
The "Previous Page" link will not be shown unless the property is set to True and the property is set to PrevNext.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.Strings.DownLevelEditColumnHeader
member.summary: Returns or sets a string of text that is displayed in the header of the edit column when editing is allowed in the down level grid.

remarks.p: The default value of this property is "Edit Column".
The text that is displayed in the header of the edit column. To see that column it is necessary to turn on the down level rendering for the grid and allow its editing .

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.Strings.DownLevelDeleteColumnHeader

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.Strings.DownLevelCancelPrompt

The text appears after an user has clicked on the edit link before. The link with the text is used to cancel any changes in the edited row and go off the edit mode.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.Strings.ViewState
member.summary: Gets a dictionary of state information (StateBag) that allows you to save and restore the view state of a server control across multiple requests for the same page.

remarks.p: A server control's view state is the accumulation of all its property values. In order to preserve these values across HTTP requests, ASP.NET server controls use this property, which is an instance of the StateBag class, to store the property values. The values are then passed as a variable to an HTML hidden input element when subsequent requests are processed. For more information about saving server control view state, see Maintaining State in a Control.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraWebGrid
member.summary: UltraWebGrid is the top-level object for the control. It provides access to the major functional areas of the control. The DisplayLayout property of UltraWebGrid contains many of the objects used to define behavior and appearance characteristics for the control. The Rows collection property allows access to the top level set of rows of the grid. If there are multiple levels, or Bands, for the grid, each of the top-level rows will allow access to any child rows that may be contained. For basic single level grids, UltraWebGrid exposes the Columns collection and the Rows collection for simple programmable access.

remarks.p: Invoke this method to programmatically generate the DemandLoad event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
This method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
When overriding DemandLoad in a derived class, be sure to call the base class' OnDemandLoad method so that registered delegates receive the event.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraWebGrid.Browser
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that determines how the control is rendered to the client.

remarks.p: The Auto (default) setting has the control determine the best way to render itself, based on the browser's capabilities.
The DownLevel setting has the control render itself using HTML 3.2.
The Uplevel setting has the control render itself using HTML 4.0 and DHTML.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraWebGrid.BackColor
member.summary: Returns or sets a Color object that specifies the background color of the control.

remarks.p: When this property is set, other objects in the grid may use the value of this property as the default value of their corresponding property.
The property specifies the foreground color of the control.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraWebGrid.BorderColor
member.summary: Returns or sets a Color object that specifies the color of the control's borders.

remarks.p: When this property is set, other objects in the grid may use the value of this property as the default value of their corresponding property.
The property specifies the style of the borders.
If the BorderStyle property is not set, this property is ignored.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraWebGrid.BorderStyle
member.summary: Returns or sets a BorderStyle object that specifies the style of the control's borders.

remarks.p: When this property is set, other objects in the grid may use the value of this property as the default value of their corresponding property.
The property specifies the color of the borders.
The property specifies the width of the borders.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraWebGrid.BorderWidth
member.summary: Returns or sets a Unit object that specifies the width of the control's borders.

remarks.p: When this property is set, other objects in the grid may use the value of this property as the default value of their corresponding property.
The property specifies the style of the borders.
If the BorderStyle property is not set, this property is ignored.
The property specifies the color of the borders.

member.summary: Returns or sets a value that specifies the amount of space between cell borders and cell values.

remarks.p: The default value of this property is 0.
When this property is set, other objects in the grid may use the value of this property as the default value of their corresponding property.
The property specifies the amount of space between each cell.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraWebGrid.CellSpacing
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that specifies the amount of space between each cell.

remarks.p: When this property is set, other objects in the grid may use the value of this property as the default value of their corresponding property.
The property specifies the amount of space between each cell.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraWebGrid.HorizontalAlign
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that specifies the horizontal alignment of the text displayed by the grid.

remarks.p: The Center setting centers text horizontally.
The Justify setting spreads text uniformly so that it is aligned with both the left and right margins.
The Left setting horizontally aligns text at the left margin.
The NotSet (default) setting indicates that horizonal alignment has not been set.
The Right setting horiztonally aligns text at the right margin.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.UltraWebGrid.GridLines
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that specifies which cell borders should be displayed for the grid.

remarks.p: When this property is set, other objects in the grid may use the value of this property as the default value of their corresponding property.
The None setting does not display borders for the cells of the grid.
The Horizontal setting displays only horizontal borders for the cells.
The Vertical setting displays only vertical borders for the cells.
The Both (default) setting displays both horizontal and vertical borders for the cells.

member.summary: Gets a dictionary of state information (StateBag) that allows you to save and restore the view state of a server control across multiple requests for the same page.

remarks.p: A server control's view state is the accumulation of all its property values. In order to preserve these values across HTTP requests, ASP.NET server controls use this property, which is an instance of the StateBag class, to store the property values. The values are then passed as a variable to an HTML hidden input element when subsequent requests are processed. For more information about saving server control view state, see Maintaining State in a Control.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ValueList
member.summary: The ValueList object maintains a list of values that the user can choose from when entering data. The ValueList is the common mechanism used to populate simple dropdown lists.
member.remarks: The ValueList object maintains a collection of items that can be displayed as the contents of a dropdown selection box. The user can click on a dropdown list in their browser and select the data supplied by the ValueList, which will appear in the grid. ValueList objects are associated with a particular column in the grid by using the ValueList property of the Column object. Each cell of the column will display the value list when placed into edit mode. ValueList objects display one value as text to the user while storing another value in the datasource.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ValueList.DataSource
member.summary: Returns or sets the data source that populates the items of the object.

remarks.p: This property is used to specify a source of data to populate a ValueList.
Use the property to specify the field in the data source specified by this property.
The and properties are used to specify the fields in the data source that will be used to populate the list.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ValueList.DataMember
member.summary: Returns or sets a string of text that specifies the record set of the data source used to populate the object.

remarks.p: Use this property to specify the record set in the data source specified by the property to populate a ValueList.

The and properties are used to specify the fields in the record set that will be used to populate the list. DisplayMember specifies the value that will be displayed to the user, ValueMember specifies the value that will be stored in the datasource.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ValueList.DisplayMember
member.summary: Returns or sets a string of text that specifies the field of the table in the data source that will provide the item text for a object.

remarks.p: Use this property to specify the field of the table in the data source specified by the and properties.
The field specified will provide the item text for a ValueList. The field providing item values is specified by the property.

This property, in conjunction with the ValueMember property, provides a way to store one value in the data source while displaying another. In this manner, the user can be presented with a list of states, for example, and if he or she selects "New York," the value "NY" could be stored in the data source. In this example, "New York" is the value of the field specified by the DisplayMember property while "NY" is the value of the field specified by the ValueMember property.
The property is used to determine whether the DisplayMember or ValueMember value is shown in the ValueList.
The default value for this property is an empty string.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ValueList.DisplayStyle
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that specifies whether DisplayText or DataValue of the ValueListItem objects are shown in the .

remarks.p: The DisplayText and DataValue properties of ValueListItems provide a way to store one value in the data source while displaying another. In this manner, the user can be presented with a list of states, for example, and if he or she selects "New York," the value "NY" could be stored in the data source. In this example, "New York" is the value of the field specified by the DisplayText property while "NY" is the value of the field specified by the DataValue property.
The DisplayText (default) setting specifies that DisplayText property of ValueListItems will be used.
The DataValue setting specifies that the values shown in the ValueList are provided by the ValueMember property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebGrid.ValueList.ValueMember
member.summary: Returns or sets a string of text that specifies the field of the table in the data source that will provide the item values for a object.

remarks.p: Use this property to specify the field of the table in the data source specified by the and properties.
The field specified will provide the item values for a ValueList. The field providing item text is specified by the property.

This property, in conjunction with the DisplayMember property, provides a way to store one value in the data source while displaying another. In this manner, the user can be presented with a list of states, for example, and if he or she selects "New York," the value "NY" could be stored in the data source. In this example, "New York" is the value of the field specified by the DisplayMember property while "NY" is the value of the field specified by the ValueMember property.
The property is used to determine whether the DisplayMember or ValueMember value is shown in the ValueList.
The default value for this property is an empty string.
